items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: High river levels today, 15 January 2026, may lead to flooding. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Church Laneham to Rampton Road. There is the potential for moderate rainfall this evening. River levels at Torksey Gauge will remain high until the 19/01/2026. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00am on 16/01/26 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Cotes, Loughborough, Zouch, Kegworth, Ratcliffe on Soar, Meadow Lane at Loughborough, the access road from Ratcliffe on Soar to Redhill Marina, the A6006 at Zouch, Soar Lane Sutton Bonnington, Moor Lane Normanton, Station Road at Kegworth, Kegworth Road, The Green Ratcliffe on Soar, Slash Lane at Sileby, the Mountsorrel to Sileby road, the B5328 Cossington Road, and the access road to Sileby Mill. Heavy rainfall is forecast this afternoon and evening. River levels at the Kegworth Gauge will begin rising at 15:00 on 15/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation & liaising with professional partners. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
Water levels are high on parts of the River Cherwell. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, near Enslow, Thrupp and Kidlington. Widespread persistant rain is expected today (Thursday 15 January) which will be heavy in places. Further rainfall is possible tomorrow. We expect river levels to rise in response and to remain high over the weekend.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 pm, midday, on the 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from the early hours of 16 January 2026 . Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Mill Lane and Water Lane at Frisby on the Wreake, Rearsby Road at Thrussington, Broome Lane at Ratcliffe on the Wreake, Frisby, farmlands at Hoby, Brooksby, Thrussington, Ratcliffe and Syston. Rainfall is forecast this afternoon and evening. River levels at Frisby on the Wreake Gauge will begin rising at 16:00 on 15/01/2026. We are closely monitoring the situation & liaising with professional partners. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026  
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle , with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole.
The current band of persistent rain will clear this evening and river levels are expected to fall overnight.
Showers are forecast for the next few days but rainfall totals will be significantly lower. 
We are closely monitoring the situation  
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water  
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ifield Brook, River Mole, Gatwick Stream, Burstow Stream

items.message:
Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from approximately 16:00. 
Rainfall today will cause river levels to rise again and may result in flooding. Locations most likely to be affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Horley area. River levels are expected to remain high for the rest of today and overnight tonight. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further messages if required. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and avoid riverside footpaths. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . 
River levels at the Stinsford River Gauge remain high and may rise in response to the rainfall today. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Frome tributaries between Dorchester and Wareham. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 17:00 as a lot of rain is forecast (20mm). 
If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect gardens of riverside properties on Forewood Lane and near Crowhurst Recreation Ground. Bexhill Road Recreation ground, and gardens that back onto (or near the Combe Haven) could also be affected. River levels could peak a little higher than on 09/01/2026. Rain is forecast to ease by 23:00 15/01/2026, with only isolated showers Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 06:00 16/01/2026 in Crowhurst and 22:00 16/01/2026 in Bulverhythe. Near to normal in Crowhurst by Friday evening, but Monday in Bulverhythe. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have .  Install flood protection products in Crowhurst. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible this evening from approximately 7pm and overnight tonight, Thursday 15 January 2026. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels are expected to be high due to the natural tide locking effects. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid using low lying footpaths which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from approximately 18:00. 
Locations most likely to be affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Areas around Kinnersley Manor and Sidlow may see flooding from approximately 18:00 today, while flooding may also affect downstream areas including Brockham, Dorking and Leatherhead from midnight tonight, as well as Cobham from approximately 06:00 tomorrow, 16th January 2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further messages if required. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: River levels on the mid Bristol Avon and Semington Brook are stable. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Further rain has started to fall and is forecast to continue through Thursday. River levels are likely to rise again in response to this rain and continue rising overnight into Friday. We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing debris from weed screens. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated on Friday morning, or sooner if the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 23:30, as a lot of rain (18mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding could affect land, fields, and roads at Cadnam, West Wellow, Landford and Ower. Water levels will also be very high around, and affect the mill building at East Wellow. Property flooding is not expected. Levels will be higher than on 14/01/2026. Rain is forecast to continue until 19:00 on Thursday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Wellow by 09:00 on Friday 16/01/26. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will ensure the river is kept free of reported blockages. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have including pumps. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: Heavy rain is expected throughout the day on Thursday 15 January, river levels are expected to rise leading to increased flooding of low lying land and roads close to the rivers, particularly on and around Water Lane and Lingfield. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 6:00pm on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 15:00, as a lot of rain is forecast (25mm). 
If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect Hammer Lane, Grove Hill, and Mill Lane Hellingly. From 21:00 15/01/2026 flooding could begin to approach properties on Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. From 03:00 16/01/2026 flooding could affect North Street, River Lane, The Old Clergy House, Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. River peaks similar to 09/01/2026. Rain should ease by 23:00 15/01/2026. Only isolated showers forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 07:00 16/01/2026 in Hellingly, and 16:00 16/01/2026 in Alfriston. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood (Mill Ln Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston). 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 17:00 as a lot of rain is forecast (25mm). 
Flooding could affect riverside properties near the White Hart pub Buxted, and Hempstead Mill, The Roller Mill, Mill Lane, River Way, Bridge Cottage & Bell Walk, Uckfield. From 20:00 15/01/2026, flooding could affect properties at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. River levels could peak a little higher than those on 09/01/2026. Rain is forecast to ease from 23:00 15/01/2026, with only isolated showers Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 06:00 16/01/2026 in Buxted, and 12:00 16/01/2026 in Isfield. River levels should return nearer to normal by Saturday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Install flood protection products in Buxted and Isfield. 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 16 January 2026 as 15mm of rain is forecast. 
Minor flooding will continue to affect fields and gardens near Fittleworth. River levels at Fittleworth are expected to rise Thursday evening. Not significantly higher than Wednesday. Minor flooding affecting fields, gardens, and roads could affect Lodsbridge near Selham from 02:00 16/01/2026. River levels again not much higher than Wednesday. Between Liss and Midhurst only minimal flood impacts are expected. The river should peak by 22:00 15/01/2026 in Liss, 11:00 16/01/2026 near Lodsbridge and Saturday in Fittleworth. Only showers from Friday, so flood risk should reduce from Saturday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have including in Lodsbridge and Fittleworth. Avoid roads that flood (Iping). 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 21:00 as a lot of rain is forecast (20mm). 
If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect the A281 at Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury. As well as extensive water in fields, flooding could also affect gardens of properties near Mock Bridge and may begin to approach buildings too. River levels could peak at a similar level to those on 09/01/2026. Rain is predicted to ease by 23:00 15/01/2026. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce at Mock Bridge by 10:00 16/01/2026. River levels should return to normal by Saturday afternoon. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood, including the A281 at Mock Bridge. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 20:00 as a lot of rain is forecast (20mm). 
If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect fields and gardens near Bridge Cottage on the B2028, properties on Sloop Lane and at Sheffield Park. Also roads at Fletching Mill Bridge and Sharpsbridge. From 02:00 16/01/2026, flooding could affect the Anchor Inn and Barcombe Mills properties with Barcombe Mills road potentially impassable. A similar event to the 09/01/2026. Rain should ease from 23:00 15/01/2026. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 08:00 16/01/2026 near Ardingly, and 18:00 near Barcombe. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and operating structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to reduce flood risk. 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood, including Barcombe Mills Road. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . 
River levels are rising at the Burton Bradstock River Gauge due to rainfall today. Flooding could affect all rivers in the West Dorset area with low lying land expected to be most affected. Flooding is possible near the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride. Rainfall is expected to ease off this afternoon, but flooding may still be possible as river levels continue to react to earlier rainfall. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and please avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to continued flooding. Flooding is possible on 15th January 2026. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Observed Peaks:- Llanymynech and Maesbrook peaked on 12/01, Cae Howel peaked at 4.2m on 13/01 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 21:00 on 15/01/26 or as the situation changes.

High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 14 January 2026 . 
Flooding may affect Gabb Lane at Apperley and local caravan parks. Predicted peak at Haw Bridge 4.6m to 4.7m on 14/01 AM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are high in response to heavy rainfall earlier in December. Levels are slowly falling but remain high, and flooding of fields and roads is still possible. Groundwater levels are falling but further rainfall in the coming days may lead to levels rising once more. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 20th January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Devon and Smite in Leicestershire and Nottinghamshire
items.message: Forecast rising river levels this evening, 15 January 2026, may lead to flooding overnight. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads along the River Smite. Church Gate and Bunnison Lane in Colston Bassett could be impassable, with potentially dangerous depths of flood water.  Areas around the River Devon could also be affected at Easthorpe, Bottesford, Belvoir Lane and the Woolsthorpe to Belvoir road in Woolsthorpe, Church Lane and Main Street in Muston. There is moderate rainfall forecast this evening. River levels at Colston Bassett Gauge will begin rising at 19:00 on 15/01/26. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00am on 16/01/26 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Clanfield Brook for Clanfield Village and the Shill Brook for Bampton
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 15 January 2026 . 
Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Clanfield area. River levels have risen due to persistent and heavy rain today. Further rainfall is possible tomorrow. We expect river levels to rise today and remain high overnight. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels. 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 22:00 as a lot of rain is forecast (20mm). 
Flooding could affect gardens of properties of Langney Green. Fields and parkland including Shinewater Park could also be affected. River levels could peak similar to 09/01/2026, or perhaps a little higher. Rainfall is forecast to ease by 23:00 15/01/2026. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Langney by 12:00 16/01/2026, but could remain higher than normal until next week. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and operating structures at Fence Bridge and Crumbles to reduce flood risk. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Install flood protection products in Langney Green. 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.
